items.title: Latin American ecommerce giant to grow workforce by 33% in 2025
items.author: Sebastian Fernandez
items.summary:
- MercadoLibre will increase its workforce by 33% in 2025, hiring 28,000 employees across Latin America, raising total headcount to 112,000.
- Most new roles will be in logistics, particularly in Brazil and Mexico, along with technology and operations positions.
- This expansion is part of a US$13.2 billion investment plan aimed at enhancing logistics and tech capabilities, while also introducing AI tools in various operations.
- MercadoLibre’s workforce strategy contrasts significantly with the broader tech industry's trend of reductions, showcasing a growth-focused approach.
- The company's corporate culture emphasizes meritocracy and flexibility, allowing for a hybrid work model and leadership development that integrates cultural values into operational policies.
- Latin America's digital economy is booming, with projected substantial growth in digital payments and e-commerce, presenting opportunities for MercadoLibre's integrated ecosystem.

items.title: Anthropic’s Claude AI integrates with Google Workspace
items.summary:
- Anthropic’s AI assistant Claude now integrates with Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Docs.
- Claude can access emails, review documents, and check calendar events without manual uploads.
- It summarizes meetings, identifies action items in emails, and extracts key details from documents.
- The tool provides inline citations to verify sources and streamline workflows.
- Context-aware AI is improving workplace productivity, with reports of significant efficiency gains from similar integrations.
- Privacy and data security remain concerns, with many consumers worried about data sharing with AI tools.

items.title: Google inks first geothermal energy deal in Taiwan
items.summary:
- Google signed its first corporate PPAs for geothermal energy in Taiwan, adding 10 megawatts to the energy grid.
- The agreements are the first of their kind in the Asia-Pacific region and support Taiwan’s 6 GW geothermal target by 2050.
- Taiwan, located along the Pacific Ring of Fire, possesses substantial untapped geothermal resources, estimated at 33,640 MW.

items.title: These funds have not invested in SEA in the past year
items.summary:
- Funds that invested in Southeast Asia in the last two years have not participated in funding rounds for tech startups in the past 12 months.
- Possible reasons include waiting for better investment conditions, shifting focus, or the market being a lower priority.
- Timing is crucial for outreach to investors in this context.
- The database is continually updated, and readers can report inaccuracies or missing information.

items.title: Foxconn, Tata Electronics ship $2b iPhones from India to US
Figma confidentially files for US IPO
SG VC firm Vertex Growth backs IP provider with $11m
items.summary:
- Singapore-based venture capital fund Vertex Growth has committed €10 million (US$11 million) to Dolphin Semiconductor, a company specializing in semiconductor IP solutions.
- The funding aims to support Dolphin Semiconductor’s growth strategy such as R&D, scaling commercial activities, and exploring consolidation opportunities.
- Dolphin focuses on meeting rising demand in industrial, high-performance computing, consumer electronics, IoT, and automotive sectors, with the investment following a €26 million (US$29.43 million) investment from Jolt Capital in November 2024.
- The semiconductor IP market is projected to grow from $7.5 billion in 2024 to $11.2 billion by 2029 at a CAGR of 8.5%.
- This funding highlights the strategic importance of semiconductor technology in Singapore’s investment portfolio, particularly in the Asia-Pacific region, which dominates the semiconductor IP market.

items.title: Blinkit launches 10-minute SIM delivery in 16 Indian cities
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Zomato-owned Blinkit has launched a 10-minute SIM card delivery service in collaboration with Bharti Airtel.
- The service is available in 16 Indian cities including Delhi, Gurugram, Bengaluru, Mumbai, and Hyderabad.
- Customers can select a new prepaid or postpaid connection or switch their existing number to Airtel.
- Blinkit CEO Albinder Dhindsa mentions that the SIM activation uses Aadhaar-based self-verification, eliminating the need for store visits or paperwork.

items.title: After riding the wave, Indonesia’s crypto space braces for impact
items.summary:
- Indonesia's crypto market transactions rose 335% year-on-year to 650.6 trillion rupiah (US$38.6 billion) in 2024.
- Tokocrypto held the largest market share at 25% trading volume, followed by Indodax at 20.5%.
- Tokocrypto claimed to achieve net profitability in 2024, focusing on impactful projects despite market volatility.

items.title: Huawei launches new AI architecture to rival Nvidia
items.summary:
- Huawei has launched a new AI infrastructure called the CloudMatrix 384 Supernode.
- The system reportedly achieves 300 petaflops of computing power, surpassing Nvidia's NVL72 system with 180 petaflops.
- The CloudMatrix 384 Supernode is part of Huawei's strategy for technological self-sufficiency amid U.S. restrictions, with the company replacing over 13,000 foreign components with domestic alternatives.
- The new system is powered by Huawei’s own Ascend 910C chips built on a 7nm process.
- The advancements in AI infrastructure signal China's growing capabilities in technology, reshaping the competitive landscape traditionally dominated by U.S. firms.

items.title: Indian digital lending platform Lendingkart names new CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lendingkart has appointed Prashant Joshi as its new CEO, focusing on micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs).
- This follows Fullerton Financial Holdings acquiring a majority stake in Lendingkart.
- Joshi has 30 years of experience in banking and previously worked at DBS Bank, IndoStar Capital Finance, Deutsche Bank, Standard Chartered Bank, and IDBI Bank.
- His appointment reflects a trend in the fintech industry to hire executives with traditional banking backgrounds amid increasing market complexity.
- Lendingkart aims to tap into the significant credit gap in India's MSME sector, where under 5% currently access formal credit.

items.title: Xi Jinping in Malaysia as ASEAN faces Trump tariff
items.summary:
- Xi Jinping's visit to Malaysia coincides with ASEAN's challenges from U.S. tariffs.
- The meeting aims to strengthen economic ties between China and Malaysia.
- Regional leaders are concerned about the implications of U.S.-China trade tensions.

items.title: Taiwan stocks jump 1.77% as US eases electronics tariffs
items.summary:
- Taiwan's stock market saw a rise on April 15, 2025, with the Taiex index increasing by 1.77%, closing at 19,857.67.
- The rally followed the US White House's announcement of tariff exemptions on electronics imports, including smartphones and computers.
- The turnover for the day reached NT$295.94 billion (US$9.12 billion), aided mainly by gains in electronics and semiconductor stocks, notably Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC), which rose by 1.39%.

items.title: VC firm Seveno Capital launches $70m wellness fund
items.summary:
- Seveno Capital has launched a new $70 million wellness fund.
- The fund aims to invest in startups focused on health and wellness sectors.
- This initiative reflects the growing interest in wellness as a significant area for innovation and investment.

items.title: Google faces Japan’s first antitrust order over smartphone apps
items.summary:
- Japan’s Fair Trade Commission (JFTC) issued a cease-and-desist order to Alphabet’s Google for anticompetitive practices.
- This is the first antitrust action against a US tech giant in Japan, announced on April 15, 2025.
- Google is required to appoint a third party to monitor compliance with the order.

items.title: Eat now, pay later
items.summary:
- BNPL (Buy Now, Pay Later) is expanding into food markets, with services offered by DoorDash in the US and KFC Malaysia.
- It is suitable for recurring purchases like groceries but may pose risks for impulsive fast food spending.
- Lower disposable incomes and regulatory gaps in Asian markets create challenges for BNPL in grocery shopping.
- Fore Coffee's IPO in Indonesia saw shares rise 34%, indicating potential recovery in tech markets.
- GXS Bank acquired Validus Investment in Singapore, and Narwal secured $100 million in funding.

items.title: B2B unicorn Moglix appoints ex-Nokia Sanjeev Arora as CFO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Moglix has appointed Sanjeev Arora as its new CFO, who has over 20 years of experience in financial roles.
- Arora previously served as CFO at ASK Automotive and has also held positions at companies like Nokia and Goodyear India.
- This appointment is part of Moglix's strategy to prepare for an IPO by 2027 after relocating its domicile from Singapore to India.
- Founded in 2015, Moglix became a unicorn in 2021 after raising $120 million in funding.

items.title: Temasek CEO was personally involved in eFishery deal, says founder
items.author: Gibran Huzaifah
items.summary:
- Gibran Huzaifah, former eFishery CEO, revealed that Temasek CEO Dilhan Pillay personally contacted him via WhatsApp to invest in a US$90 million funding round in 2021.
- Pillay's approach was notable as he rarely reaches out to founders for pitches.
- Huzaifah previously met SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son, who valued eFishery at approximately US$200 million.
- eFishery eventually secured a total funding offer valuing the company at US$410 million.
- Huzaifah admitted to faking financial figures shared with investors due to a short runway of only three months.
- After leaving eFishery, Huzaifah started a frozen food business and faces potential legal action from investors.

items.title: Indonesia’s Danantara agrees to $4b investment fund with Qatar
items.summary:
- Indonesia’s Danantara has established a $4 billion joint investment fund with Qatar to boost investments in Indonesia.
- The agreement was finalized on April 12 during a meeting between Qatari Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani and Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto.
- Both countries will contribute $2 billion each to the fund, which will focus on strategic investments, particularly in food security and energy.
- The fund is a key response to Indonesia experiencing a 10.59% decline in FDI in 2023.
- This investment reflects the strengthening economic ties between Qatar and Indonesia, which reached $1.13 billion in trade in 2024.
- The partnership represents a shift from trade-based relations to significant direct investments, signaling Qatar's strategic interest in Indonesia.

items.title: Kuaishou unveils Kling 2.0 with multimodal AI video editor
items.summary:
- Kuaishou launched Kling 2.0, an upgraded generative AI model for video and image creation.
- The new “Master Edition” improves semantic understanding, visual quality, and user control with a multimodal video editing tool.
- Kling 2.0 enhances controllability, making sophisticated video creation tools accessible for less tech-savvy users, focusing on authentic content from lower-tier cities.

items.title: Alibaba’s 1688 backs exporters’ pivot with AI tools, waived fees
items.summary:
- Alibaba’s B2B platform 1688 introduces a support package for Chinese manufacturers shifting from exports to domestic sales.
- The initiative includes five measures: help offloading excess inventory, waiving commission fees, and providing loans for business stability during the transition.
- 1688 will waive three months of platform fees and make AI-powered tools free, assisting with listings, pricing, and customer engagement.
- The move responds to declining overseas orders and aims to support sellers amid changing global trade conditions.

items.title: JD.com to hire 50,000 more couriers to expand 30-min delivery
items.summary:
- JD.com plans to hire over 50,000 full-time couriers this quarter.
- New hires will receive full social insurance and housing fund coverage.
- This expansion supports its on-demand delivery service, Miao Song, which delivers in under 30 minutes.
- JD.com competes in China's growing instant delivery market, which processed 42 billion orders in 2023.
- The integration of 100,000 offline stores into its delivery network enhances its service capabilities.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Chinese chip traders said to halt price quotes
items.summary:
- Chinese semiconductor traders have halted price quotes for clients due to anticipated shipment disruptions from ongoing tariff conflicts.
- Major electronics market sellers in Shenzhen's Huaqiangbei have ceased to quote prices for CPUs and graphic cards.
- From January to March 2025, China imported 131.25 billion integrated circuit (IC) units valued at $88.3 billion; exports totaled 76.13 billion IC units valued at $40.9 billion, reflecting a year-on-year increase in both volume and value.
- The US-China semiconductor dispute underscores interdependence, where tariffs could harm US semiconductor manufacturers that rely on domestic components sent to China for assembly.
- The trade tensions have led to a “tariff boomerang” effect, causing companies to either absorb costs or pass them to consumers rather than relocating manufacturing.
- The US may face more challenges in this trade conflict due to China's position as a major consumer of global semiconductor supply.
- China is utilizing targeted export restrictions on critical minerals to leverage its position in the supply chain, complicating matters for non-Chinese chip producers.
- Trade tensions are accelerating China's efforts towards semiconductor self-sufficiency, prompting increased R&D investments despite restrictions on access to high-quality chips.

items.title: Wells Fargo Expands Tech Banking Team by 20% Amid US Tech Sector Growth
items.author: Dzung Nguyen, Matt Servatius, Jim Bryski
items.summary:
- Wells Fargo's technology banking unit has increased its workforce by 20% over the past year, driven by growth in the US tech sector.
- The bank is planning to continue hiring in 2025, focusing on sectors including software, fintech, ecommerce, and semiconductors.
- The expansion reflects a broader strategic shift in banking towards technology due to increased regulatory pressure and competition from fintech companies.
- CEO Charlie Scharf highlighted concerns over tariffs affecting economic growth and tech companies, which may pose challenges for the expanding tech banking division.

items.title: Kraken launches commission-free stock trading
items.summary:
- Kraken has started offering commission-free trading for over 11,000 US-listed stocks and ETFs.
- The rollout began on April 14, 2025, available in certain states like New Jersey and Oklahoma.
- Kraken aims to expand stock trading services to more US states and international markets, including the UK and Australia.

items.title: UK insurtech startup Marshmallow raises $90m at $2b valuation
items.author: Oliver Kent-Braham, Alexander Kent-Braham, David Goaté
items.summary:
- Marshmallow secures US$90 million in funding led by Portage Capital, with BlackRock and Columbia Lake Partners participating.
- Company valuation increases to over US$2 billion from US$1.25 billion in 2021.
- Focuses on car insurance for immigrants and underserved populations, insuring 1 million drivers with a US$500 million annual revenue run rate.
- New funding will support expansion into financial services and additional insurance products.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Taiwan to assess chip industry impact
items.summary:
- Taiwan's Economy Minister Kuo Jyh-huei announced on April 15 that the government will evaluate the potential effects of proposed US tariffs on its semiconductor industry.
- The US is considering these tariffs due to national security concerns regarding foreign reliance on semiconductors and pharmaceuticals.
- Taiwan plans discussions with Washington to address tariff effects and ensure fair competition concerning its significant role as a chip supplier to the US.

items.title: AMD CEO says company ready to make chips at TSMC US plant
items.summary:
- Lisa Su, CEO of AMD, announced readiness to start chip production at TSMC's Arizona facility.
- Plans to increase production of AI servers in the U.S. were shared.
- The Arizona plant is a significant step towards expanding U.S. semiconductor production.
- TSMC is investing $12 billion in the Arizona facility as part of a larger global expansion strategy.
- AMD aims to address supply chain security and tariff concerns through U.S. manufacturing.
- Proposed U.S. semiconductor tariffs could impact semiconductor firms like AMD.
- AMD gains ground in the AI chip market, with MI300 series expected to generate over $5 billion in its first year.
- The global AI chip market is projected to exceed $300 billion by 2030, highlighting demand for reliable manufacturing capacity.

items.title: Trump’s crypto adviser maps out policy shift
Apple leads global smartphone sales in Q1
items.summary:
- Apple secured the top position in global smartphone sales in Q1 2025, capturing 19% market share, slightly ahead of Samsung at 18%.
- The sales success is attributed to the launch of the iPhone 16e and strong demand in Japan and India, despite flat or declining sales in the US, Europe, and China.
- Competition from local brands in China, particularly Huawei, and limited AI features in Apple devices are impacting its performance.

items.title: Japan’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- The article explores the most well-funded tech companies in Japan over the last decade.
- It provides insights into funding rounds, amounts raised, and significant investors.
- Trends in investment and the impact of technology on the Japanese economy are discussed.

items.title: Intel to sell 51% stake in its chip business for $4.46b
items.summary:
- Intel is selling a 51% stake in its Altera business to Silver Lake for $4.46 billion.
- The deal, announced on April 14, 2025, values Altera at $8.75 billion, down from the $17 billion Intel paid in 2015.
- Altera generated $1.54 billion in revenue but reported a $615 million operating loss in 2024, making up only 3% of Intel's sales.

items.title: CATL reports 32.9% profit growth, fastest in two years
items.summary:
- CATL reported a 32.9% increase in net profit for Q1 2025, amounting to 14 billion yuan (US$1.92 billion).
- Revenue grew by 6.2% to 84.7 billion yuan (US$11.59 billion), ending five quarters of decline.
- The company is preparing for a listing on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, targeting to raise at least US$5 billion in Q2 2025.
- CATL holds a 38.2% global market share in EV battery installations as of January-February 2025.
- Total global EV battery usage was 129.9 GWh in early 2025, reflecting a 40.3% increase year-over-year.
- CATL is diversifying by negotiating a controlling stake in NIO’s power unit and investing in battery swapping infrastructure.

items.title: EV motor startup Conifer secures $20m seed funding
items.summary:
- Conifer, founded by former Lucid Motors and Apple engineers, has secured $20 million in seed funding from investors including True Ventures, MaC Ventures, and MFV Partners.
- The startup focuses on developing electric motors using ferrite magnets, aiming to replace rare earth materials and tackle supply chain vulnerabilities in the EV industry.
- Conifer plans to implement automated, localized microfactories for production, aligning with industry shifts towards regional manufacturing and responding to COVID-19 supply chain disruptions.

items.title: Founders Fund, Peter Thiel back $50m for nuclear startup
items.summary:
- Founders Fund and Peter Thiel invested $50 million in a nuclear startup.
- The funding aims to advance nuclear energy technologies.
- This investment reflects the growing interest in sustainable energy solutions.

items.title: AMD seeks bidders for $4b AI server plant sale
items.summary:
- Taiwanese firms such as Compal Electronics and Wiwynn Corp. are preparing bids for AMD's AI server plants in Texas and New Jersey.
- The sale is valued between $3 billion and $4 billion, following AMD's acquisition of the plants via the $4.9 billion purchase of ZT Systems in March.
- AMD plans to complete the sale by the end of Q2 2025, aiming to divest from manufacturing to avoid competing with customers like Dell and HP.
- The plants employ approximately 1,500 skilled workers and were previously valued at $1.5 billion to $3 billion by Bloomberg Intelligence.
- This sale comes as Taiwanese electronics companies are expanding in the US due to tariff concerns, particularly amidst rising demand for AI server production.

items.title: Patrizia, Mitsui invest $350m in low-carbon cooling across Asia
items.summary:
- Patrizia and Mitsui & Co., Ltd. invested up to US$350 million in low-carbon cooling solutions through the APAC Sustainable Infrastructure Fund (A-SIF).
- Investment supports the growth of Kaer’s Cooling as a Service (CaaS) business across Singapore, Malaysia, India, and Indonesia, with expansion plans into Thailand and Vietnam.
- A-SIF acquires a minority stake in Kaer, marking its fourth investment focusing on sustainable infrastructure, alongside renewable energy and urban mobility commitments.

items.title: Strategy buys 3,459 bitcoins for $285.8m
items.summary:
- **Acquisition Details**: Bitcoin-focused firm Strategy acquired 3,459 BTC for approximately US$285.8 million on April 13, 2025.
- **Average Price**: The purchase was made at an average price of US$82,618 per bitcoin.
- **Total Holdings**: Strategy now holds a total of 531,644 BTC, valued at over US$45 billion.
- **Investment**: Strategy has invested a total of US$35.9 billion in bitcoin, with an average purchase price of US$67,556.
- **Funding Sources**: The funds for this purchase were generated through the sale of its Class A common stock, MSTR.

items.title: Chipmaker Onsemi halts $6.9b bid to acquire Allegro MicroSystems
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Onsemi has suspended its $6.9 billion acquisition of Allegro MicroSystems.
- The decision follows regulatory concerns and market conditions affecting the semiconductor industry.
- Analysts note that this pause could impact Onsemi's growth strategy and market positioning.

items.title: Russia eyes investment in Indonesia’s Danantara: minister
items.summary:
- Russian investors are considering investments in Indonesia's Danantara sovereign wealth fund, focusing on mining and energy sectors.
- Indonesia needs approximately 13,453 trillion rupiah (US$800 billion) by 2029 to achieve an 8% annual economic growth rate by 2028.
- Potential areas for investment also include cybersecurity, small modular reactors, tourism, and education.
- Russia-Indonesia relations are evolving into an economic partnership, with bilateral trade totaling $2.43 billion in 2023.
- Indonesia faces significant economic challenges, such as a decline in the middle-class population and job losses in manufacturing, despite steady 5% GDP growth.

items.title: LG Electronics, others back $15m investment in Korean AI startup
items.summary:
- RLWRLD, a physical AI startup, secured US$15 million in a seed funding round, backed by various industrial firms including LG Electronics and SK Telecom.
- The funding will be used to enhance robotics models and grow industrial data pipelines.
- This investment reflects a broader trend of cross-border industrial alliances shaping global AI development ecosystems.

items.title: Indian gov’t orders telecom firms to disclose Chinese equipment use
Indian teacher upskilling firm Centa bags $2.3m series A1
US Republican senators urge Trump to reject Biden’s AI chip rule
items.author: Pete Ricketts, Thom Tillis, Markwayne Mullin, Ted Budd, Roger Wicker, Eric Schmitt, Tommy Tuberville
items.summary:
- Seven Republican senators requested the withdrawal of the Biden administration's AI Diffusion rule in a letter dated April 11, 2025.
- The AI Diffusion rule was issued on January 13, 2025, and is set to take effect on May 15, 2025.
- The senators believe the regulation may harm US leadership in AI by creating investment uncertainty and risking global partnerships.
- Concerns include a shift in US export control strategy towards a three-tier classification system impacting access to advanced technologies.
- US tech companies warn that the new rule could create artificial scarcity and harm American competitiveness.

items.title: Chinese ecommerce app DHGate hits top of US app store
items.summary:
- DHGate reached number 3 on the US App Store's free iPhone apps chart on April 14, 2025.
- The app surged after viral videos from Chinese manufacturers about the luxury goods supply chain.
- Downloads increased by 56% on April 12, 2025, with 35,400 total downloads, 17,300 from US users, marking a 98% rise in US downloads.

items.title: Chinese TikTok influencers challenge US tariffs with direct sales
items.summary:
- Chinese influencers on TikTok encourage US consumers to buy directly from factories in China.
- They highlight the impact of US tariffs, including a 145% levy on Chinese goods, on retail prices.
- TikTok videos showcase factories supplying brands like Lululemon and Nike, revealing significant price disparities between manufacturing and retail costs, e.g., Lululemon leggings costing $5-$6 versus $100 in the US.
- The trend occurs alongside the May 2 elimination of a rule allowing duty-free imports under $800, pushing manufacturers to establish direct sales relationships quickly.
- TikTok serves as a platform for both trade dispute implications and consumer influence, amidst US-China tensions over tariffs and national security concerns.

items.title: US tariffs shift Chinese goods to UK, sparking retailer concerns
items.summary:
- British retailers are worried about a surge of low-cost Chinese goods entering the UK due to 145% tariffs on Chinese imports by the US.
- The closure of a tax loophole for imports valued up to US$800 may redirect goods to Europe, affecting UK competition and quality.
- Calls for reconsideration of the UK's tax exemption on imports worth up to £135 (US$178) are increasing as UK retail faces challenges from shifting Chinese sellers.

items.title: Meituan launches 24/7 shopping with 30-minute delivery in China
items.summary:
- Meituan has launched an instant retail brand called Meituan Shangou, offering 24-hour shopping through its app.
- Deliveries are expected to occur within approximately 30 minutes for a variety of products including food, electronics, and more.
- The initiative aims to meet the growing demand for fast shopping options in China, amid significant infrastructure investments for rapid delivery capabilities.
- The instant retail market is projected to grow massively, reaching RMB 3.6 trillion by 2030.
- Younger consumers, particularly Gen Z, are driving demand for immediacy, with over 50% expecting same-day deliveries.

items.title: Google develops AI model to decode dolphin sounds
Chinese AI startup Zhipu plans IPO, open-sources 32b models
items.summary:
- Zhipu AI is preparing for an initial public offering (IPO), filed on April 14, with CICC as its advisor.
- Founded in 2019 from Tsinghua University, it focuses on cognitive AI models like ChatGLM and CogView.
- Zhipu open-sourced its GLM-4-32B-0414 AI models on the same day, featuring 32 billion parameters.
- The company expects to complete IPO preparations by October 2025, aiming for a public listing as the first prominent AI startup in China.
- Investments received from Tencent, Alibaba, and others highlight significant backing for its IPO plans.
